page.title: 13Birds of the Greatworth area
page.content: The ecology of the area is greatly benefited by the presence of a wide range of birds.A member of the Royal Society for the protection of birds has observed 104 different species of birds over the past twelve years.Most of the common birds frequent the area along with............ kingfishers,sparrowhawks,great spotted and green lesser spotted woodpeckers. Rare birds which visit this area are the kite which was seen in 1972 and the nightingale which has not been seen or heard since 1971.The hobby which is a rare falcon has been several times each summer and is thought to nest locally. The R.S.P.B. member lives at the Reading Room, Greatworth.She looks after many injured birds and animals brought to her by the children of the village.
